comments.body: What is noteworthily "atomic" about this?  There is only one etcd key operated on, right, so of course it is atomic?

It is modifying one key, but the modification is mandating an etcd atomic compare and swap based on the resource version. 

Sent from my iPhone

> On Jan 27, 2015, at 3:50 AM, Eric Tune notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In pkg/registry/resourcequota/registry.go:
> 
> > -   "github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pkg/runtime"
> > -   "github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pkg/tools"
> >   +)
> >   +
> >   +// Registry implements operations to modify ResourceQuota objects
> >   +type Registry interface {
> > -   generic.Registry
> > -   resourcequotausage.Registry
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +// registry implements custom changes to generic.Etcd.
> >   +type registry struct {
> > -   *etcdgeneric.Etcd
> >   +}
> >   +
> >   +// ApplyStatus atomically updates the ResourceQuotaStatus based on the observed ResourceQuotaUsage
> >   What is noteworthily "atomic" about this? There is only one etcd key operated on, right, so of course it is atomic?
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
